title: Is Billie Eilish's music boring? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s a celebration of low effort minimalism and generation z detachment that’s rooted in a future that doesn’t exist, a past that’s been romanticized beyond their familiarity, a sarcastic and ironic nod to the absolutely shittier music that was already out there, and a product of 2019 - a year when we still glorify any dude with a lap top who can properly package a teenage girl with a voice in a way that looks so stale… that it’s somehow fresh. Its not entirely bad, but it’s not exactly Whitney Houston, it’s not a good faith effort, it’s not any more than exactly 1/2 of an ass of effort, and that’s part of the message. She’s here to say that this is the hardest she should try, and she has a point - we haven’t exactly given a better world to people that age. If anything, we’re the garbage, not her

I like her James Bond theme . She has done a very good job in my opinion . She is one of those people who will polarize opinion . I have no doubt that she is currently a huge favourite of teenagers and maybe even pre teens . But the older generations won’t much care for her. I watched her set at Glastonbury last year out of curiosity. I can’t say she made any impression on me either way. So I was surprised when I heard she was going to be recording the new James Bond theme. But I have to say she has done a very good job. The people involved in James Bond clearly want to appeal to a younger audience , and I suspect they have now succeeded. Bravo Billy
